member.name: T:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateWorkspace operation. Creates a workspace. In a workspace, you can create Grafana dashboards and visualizations to analyze your metrics, logs, and traces. You don't have to build, package, or deploy any hardware to run the Grafana server.
Don't use CreateWorkspace to modify an existing workspace. Instead, use UpdateWorkspace.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.AccountAccessType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountAccessType.
Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the same organization. If you specify ORGANIZATION, you must specify which organizational units the workspace can access in the workspaceOrganizationalUnits parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.AuthenticationProviders
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationProviders.
Specifies whether this workspace uses SAML 2.0, Amazon Web Services Single Sign On, or both to authenticate users for using the Grafana console within a workspace. For more information, see User authentication in Amazon Managed Grafana.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A unique, case-sensitive, user-provided identifier to ensure the idempotency of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.OrganizationRoleName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrganizationRoleName.
The name of an IAM role that already exists to use with Organizations to access Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels in other accounts in an organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.PermissionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PermissionType.
If you specify Service Managed, Amazon Managed Grafana automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels.
If you specify CUSTOMER_MANAGED, you will manage those roles and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a member account of an organization that is not a delegated administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you must choose CUSTOMER_MANAGED.
For more information, see Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.StackSetName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StackSetName.
The name of the CloudFormation stack set to use to generate IAM roles to be used for this workspace.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceDataSources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceDataSources.
Specify the Amazon Web Services data sources that you want to be queried in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed Grafana to read data from these sources. You must still add them as data sources in the Grafana console in the workspace.
If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a data source in the workspace console later. However, you will then have to manually configure permissions for it.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceDescription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceDescription.
A description for the workspace. This is used only to help you identify this workspace.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceName.
The name for the workspace. It does not have to be unique.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceNotificationDestinations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceNotificationDestinations.
Specify the Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to use in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceOrganizationalUnits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceOrganizationalUnits.
Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part of an organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.CreateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceRoleArn.
The workspace needs an IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services resources that the workspace will view data from. If you already have a role that you want to use, specify it here. If you omit this field and you specify some Amazon Web Services resources in workspaceDataSources or workspaceNotificationDestinations, a new IAM role with the necessary permissions is automatically created.

member.name: T:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.ListPermissionsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListPermissions operation. Lists the users and groups who have the Grafana Admin and Editor roles in this workspace. If you use this operation without specifying userId or groupId, the operation returns the roles of all users and groups. If you specify a userId or a groupId, only the roles for that user or group are returned. If you do this, you can specify only one userId or one groupId.

member.summary:

The maximum number of results to include in the response.

member.summary:

The token to use when requesting the next set of results. You received this token from a previous ListPermissions operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.ListPermissionsRequest.UserId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserId.
(Optional) Limits the results to only the user that matches this ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.ListPermissionsRequest.UserType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserType.
(Optional) If you specify SSO_USER, then only the permissions of Amazon Web Services SSO users are returned. If you specify SSO_GROUP, only the permissions of Amazon Web Services SSO groups are returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication operation. Use this operation to define the identity provider (IdP) that this workspace authenticates users from, using SAML. You can also map SAML assertion attributes to workspace user information and define which groups in the assertion attribute are to have the Admin and Editor roles in the workspace.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationRequest.AuthenticationProviders
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationProviders.
Specifies whether this workspace uses SAML 2.0, Amazon Web Services Single Sign On, or both to authenticate users for using the Grafana console within a workspace. For more information, see User authentication in Amazon Managed Grafana.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationRequest.SamlConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SamlConfiguration.
If the workspace uses SAML, use this structure to map SAML assertion attributes to workspace user information and define which groups in the assertion attribute are to have the Admin and Editor roles in the workspace.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationRequest.WorkspaceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceId.
The ID of the workspace to update the authentication for.

member.name: T:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceAuthenticationResponse.Authentication
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Authentication.
A structure that describes the user authentication for this workspace after the update is made.

member.name: T:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateWorkspace operation. Modifies an existing Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If you use this operation and omit any optional parameters, the existing values of those parameters are not changed.
To modify the user authentication methods that the workspace uses, such as SAML or Amazon Web Services SSO, use UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication.
To modify which users in the workspace have the Admin and Editor Grafana roles, use UpdatePermissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest.AccountAccessType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountAccessType.
Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the same organization. If you specify ORGANIZATION, you must specify which organizational units the workspace can access in the workspaceOrganizationalUnits parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest.OrganizationRoleName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrganizationRoleName.
The name of an IAM role that already exists to use to access resources through Organizations.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest.PermissionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PermissionType.
If you specify Service Managed, Amazon Managed Grafana automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels.
If you specify CUSTOMER_MANAGED, you will manage those roles and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a member account of an organization and that account is not a delegated administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you must choose CUSTOMER_MANAGED.
For more information, see Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest.StackSetName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StackSetName.
The name of the CloudFormation stack set to use to generate IAM roles to be used for this workspace.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceDataSources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceDataSources.
Specify the Amazon Web Services data sources that you want to be queried in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed Grafana to read data from these sources. You must still add them as data sources in the Grafana console in the workspace.
If you don't specify a data source here, you can still add it as a data source later in the workspace console. However, you will then have to manually configure permissions for it.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceDescription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceDescription.
A description for the workspace. This is used only to help you identify this workspace.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceId.
The ID of the workspace to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceName.
A new name for the workspace to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceNotificationDestinations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceNotificationDestinations.
Specify the Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to use in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceOrganizationalUnits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceOrganizationalUnits.
Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part of an organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest.WorkspaceRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WorkspaceRoleArn.
The workspace needs an IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services resources that the workspace will view data from. If you already have a role that you want to use, specify it here. If you omit this field and you specify some Amazon Web Services resources in workspaceDataSources or workspaceNotificationDestinations, a new IAM role with the necessary permissions is automatically created.

Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the same organization. If this is ORGANIZATION, the workspaceOrganizationalUnits parameter specifies which organizational units the workspace can access.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.WorkspaceDescription.Authentication
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Authentication.
A structure that describes whether the workspace uses SAML, Amazon Web Services SSO, or both methods for user authentication.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.WorkspaceDescription.DataSources
member.summary:

member.summary:

member.summary:

The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, to allow Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.WorkspaceDescription.OrganizationalUnits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrganizationalUnits.
Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part of an organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.WorkspaceDescription.OrganizationRoleName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrganizationRoleName.
The name of the IAM role that is used to access resources through Organizations.

member.name: P:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.WorkspaceDescription.PermissionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PermissionType.
If this is Service Managed, Amazon Managed Grafana automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels.
If this is CUSTOMER_MANAGED, you manage those roles and permissions yourself. If you are creating this workspace in a member account of an organization and that account is not a delegated administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you must choose CUSTOMER_MANAGED.
For more information, see Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels

member.name: T:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.AmazonManagedGrafanaClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing ManagedGrafana
Amazon Managed Grafana is a fully managed and secure data visualization service that you can use to instantly query, correlate, and visualize operational metrics, logs, and traces from multiple sources. Amazon Managed Grafana makes it easy to deploy, operate, and scale Grafana, a widely deployed data visualization tool that is popular for its extensible data support.
With Amazon Managed Grafana, you create logically isolated Grafana servers called workspaces. In a workspace, you can create Grafana dashboards and visualizations to analyze your metrics, logs, and traces without having to build, package, or deploy any hardware to run Grafana servers.

member.name: M:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.AmazonManagedGrafanaClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonManagedGrafanaClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.AmazonManagedGrafanaClient.UpdateWorkspace(Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest)
member.summary:
Modifies an existing Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If you use this operation and omit any optional parameters, the existing values of those parameters are not changed.
To modify the user authentication methods that the workspace uses, such as SAML or Amazon Web Services SSO, use UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication.
To modify which users in the workspace have the Admin and Editor Grafana roles, use UpdatePermissions.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateWorkspace service method.

member.name: T:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.IAmazonManagedGrafana
member.summary:
Interface for accessing ManagedGrafana
Amazon Managed Grafana is a fully managed and secure data visualization service that you can use to instantly query, correlate, and visualize operational metrics, logs, and traces from multiple sources. Amazon Managed Grafana makes it easy to deploy, operate, and scale Grafana, a widely deployed data visualization tool that is popular for its extensible data support.
With Amazon Managed Grafana, you create logically isolated Grafana servers called workspaces. In a workspace, you can create Grafana dashboards and visualizations to analyze your metrics, logs, and traces without having to build, package, or deploy any hardware to run Grafana servers.

member.name: M:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.IAmazonManagedGrafana.ListPermissions(Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.ListPermissionsRequest)
member.summary: Lists the users and groups who have the Grafana Admin and Editor roles in this workspace. If you use this operation without specifying userId or groupId, the operation returns the roles of all users and groups. If you specify a userId or a groupId, only the roles for that user or group are returned. If you do this, you can specify only one userId or one groupId.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListPermissions service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.ManagedGrafana.IAmazonManagedGrafana.UpdateWorkspace(Amazon.ManagedGrafana.Model.UpdateWorkspaceRequest)
member.summary:
Modifies an existing Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If you use this operation and omit any optional parameters, the existing values of those parameters are not changed.
To modify the user authentication methods that the workspace uses, such as SAML or Amazon Web Services SSO, use UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication.
To modify which users in the workspace have the Admin and Editor Grafana roles, use UpdatePermissions.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateWorkspace service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateWorkspace service method, as returned by ManagedGrafana.
